page.title: 06SOME NORWICH STREET NAMES
page.content: { {UNTHANK ROAD}named after Colonel Unthank a 19th century landlord.In the 14th century "Unthank" meant land which had been settled on without permission of the Lord of the Manor. {PARK LANE}was also close to Colonel Unthanks 'park'.It was once called Asylum Lane because there was a lunatic asylum at the Unthank road end.Park Lane was a high class area and the gasmen were chosen so that they wouldn't smoke,spit or swear.{ {COLLEGE ROAD} named after the college for trainee teachers which was destroyed by bombs in 1942.The girl students tried to fight the fires, but with only buckets of water, they didn't succeed.
